headline: Spinach and Artichoke Dip
description: This easy spinach and artichoke dip is sure to be a hit at your next party. It's creamy, cheesy, and oh-so-good on crackers, pita chips, or toasted bread.
name: Spinach and Artichoke Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 1-quart baking dish.
Combine artichoke hearts, spinach, and mayonnaise in a bowl; mix in 2 cups Monterey Jack, then mix in Parmesan. Transfer to the prepared baking dish and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup Monterey Jack.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Friends & family love this dip!!
Looking yummy ðŸ˜‹ can't wait to eat it.
Family loves this
So simple and delicious to make. Gone so fast! Everyone asked for the recipe.
Made it with stated ingredients. Its ready to go in the oven quick and is so yummy!!
I Made it per the recipe, but I usually double it because it's so good
This was delicious and simple! I sautÃ©ed fresh spinach in butter and garlic! Yum thank You!
Great base for dip but did need something more flavorful for us. We use pepperjack cheese instead of what it calls for and it gives the dip a perfect zing!

We Love the La Terra Fina Spinach Artichoke Parmesan cold dip. This recipe is close. Here are the ingredients of that dip...Cream Cheese, Spinach, Mayonnaise, Onions, Artichokes, Monterey Jack cheese, Parmesan Cheese, Garlic, Sea salt, Sugar, Spices. So the missing ingredients, in my opinion, for a more flavorful dip are: Cream Cheese, onions, garlic, sea salt, sweetener and spice in that order.
I made this just as the recipe calls for. The flavor was just OK. It was a bit cheesy for my taste.
Pretty good! A little bit greasy with all the cheese but still fabulous!
This was a very easy and very good recipe..I will definitely be making this again..the only change I made was adding diced tomatoes on top..it was a hit!
This was a huge hit for the last several parties I've brought it to! EVERYONE comments on how good it is and it's so easy to make! Highly recommend!
Very good!
This was a huge hit with friends and family. I highly recommend it. YUMMY!!!
This was good but I would add something like Alfredo sauce to make it creamier. I would also cut back on the spinach since it overpowered the overall taste.
This is delicious. I used half mayonnaise and half sour cream. I also added some garlic powder and black pepper. Very easy to make and definitely will make again!
All of the cheese clumped together. Flavor was good but not a chip dip at all.
Fantastic
This was tasty and satisfying but not as creamy as I would have liked. Still we ate it all up.

First and foremost--you must double the recipe! IT'S THAT GOOD! (Your guests will be so disappointed if you run out of this one. ) I find it takes about 45 minutes to bake until a nice golden brown on top. I am careful to cut the artichoke into very small pieces. I have made it several times.
I did it like the recipe except added 1/2 cup spicey Monterey Jack on top yummy

I made this recipe â€œas is â€œ except substituting half the mayo for sour cream. Yum! It was a big hit all around. I did freeze half of it for later use as it makes a substantial amount and we only had 6 people. I served with both pita and tortilla chips. People could not stop eating it!
The only change I made was adding 2 cloves minced garlic, otherwise followed the recipe. Best when hot out of the oven. Yummy, I could eat it all myself. Serve with nacho chips.

Excellent dip with tortilla strip chips. My BFF couldn't believe that I made it... asked which restaurant I picked it up from...
Delicious dip as is, I added a teaspoon of minced garlic for more flavor, everyone loved it!!
This dip is amazing! I make this all the time and it is always a huge hit.

Yum! I couldnâ€™t find Colby Jack Cheese in the store I went to so I used mozzarella cheese in place of it. I also prepared it and let it sit in the fridge for two days before making it. It came out great! Thanks for such an easy delicious recipe! I know what I am taking to my next food event or potluck!
I added onion powder and extra cheese and yes I will make it again
AMAZING!!

This dip was easy & quick to make, a winner as a "go to" appetizer prior to a casual dinner or just to enjoy with a glass of wine. I played with the cheese combination a bit, adding a little Romano Asiago blend to the Monterrey Jack that the recipe called for, Parmesan was added as per recipe. I added some dehydrated white onion bits, ground pepper and seasoned salt. The recipe yielded enough to split in 2, even 3 portions, freezing the remaining dip in small containers for later use.
This was very bland, I would never make it again.
Simple and yummy. Everyone enjoys this!

Made this for the first time to bring to a party. It was excellent. I've made other artichoke dips before, but this was a new recipe for me with the addition of spinach. I followed the recipe exactly. There were several other types of dip at the party and mine went the quickest. Can't wait to make it again.
Super easy to make and was a hit with everyone!
It was yummy!!
Delicious! Whole family enjoyed it!
I made it exactly as written and it was excellent. I would definitely make it again.
I had some left over beet greens in the freezer. I let them thaw and squeezed the juices out. This was an awesome appetizer for family and friends.
Just not as flavorful as we live it. I will look for a different recipe next time.
Wonerfully cheesy!
Loved this! So did all the people I had over

This was super easy to make and tasted fabulous. I actually pre-made mine, placed in the fridge and then cooked it after guests were here. By having it in fridge chilling I had to bake it for 25 minutes instead of 15 to make sure it was good and warm all the way thru.
Crowd pleaser
Simple and yummy! I will make it next with some garlic and hot sauce to see how it comes out. But this is a great recipe as is! FYI do not over grease baking dish.
This is a go to recipe for parties and always a hit. I make it exactly as written and serve with pita chips or tostitos.
This is a go to recipe for parties and always a hit. I make it exactly as written and serve with pita chips or tostitos.
Love this recipie! I added fresh garlic. I also used half mayo and half Greek yogurt for a little bit more healthy version. Lastly I used half Parmesan cheese and half Monterey cheddar.
Very bland. I served it at a party and nobody ate it.

I added 2 garlic cloves chopped,I also used half cup mayonnaise, 1/2 cup cream cheese, and instead of Monterey Jack cheese, I used Queso Chihuahua quesadilla cheese...I put it in the crock pot on low for 1 hour, it came out fabulous, once the cheese on top is melted, it's done.
Easy and tasty. Followed others advice and did half mayo, half sour cream. Added garlic and red pepper flakes to add a kick. Very good.
Will probably use fresh spinach the next time around!!! It tasted good but I could tell he spinach was frozen.
I have made this for years and people love it every time. It can also be put into a crockpot and kept warm during the party.
pretty good the dip melts in your mouth and if u want a small crunch add some sauteed onions
Excellent with some garlic powder and seasoning salt.
This has been a favorite of our family for years...
Pretty tasteless even after adding extra seasonings

This was good and RICH, but could have used some garlic powder, paprika, maybe even a little pepper? No salt though as someone else mentioned, as the mayo and cheese are plenty salty. Served this with homemade pita chips.

"This is the best spinach artichoke dip I've ever had" is what everyone said at our party today. Absolutely loved it!! The person who said they topped it with crab before baking, what a great idea. That made it extra special!!

The EASIEST, BEST recipe for spinach artichoke dip ever! Look no furthur. However it doesn't call for any salt, pepper or spices. Make sure you add these!! I added salt, white and black pepper, crushed red pepper, Italian seasoning, fresh garlic(or garlic powder) and drizzled a little olive oil over the top! I used " veganese"instead of real mayo because it is what I had, but it was great and I will always use it instead. Came out amazing, will be my go to from now on!
FYI**I didn't use the exact measurements the recipe called for because I was making it in a small ramekin for two people, not a large serving. I actually just eyed the whole thing and stirred it all right in my baking dish. You don't have to be super precise with it just make sure it has almost an even distribution of veggies and cheese and mayo!(add a little more spinach then you think you should) justMake sure the veggies are coated well! And don't forget the olive oil drizzle instead of pre greasing your pan! ENJOY!
I made this recipe. Substituted sour cream, no mayo. Followed the recipe but added 2 cloves garlic, pinch a salt, couple twists of ground pepper and a dash of hot sauce. FABULOUS!

This recipe is so good! I used to make another recipe for this dip, but this one is much better w a few changes. It definitely needs at least one clove of garlic, some pepper, and use 1/2 cup mayo and a little more than 1/2 cup light sour cream.

This dip was good but a little too cheesy. I will make it again though. Next time I am going to shoot for a creamier base with a bit less cheese. One thing I did differently was to add pepper jack cheese, it was pretty tasty. What I disliked the most, no fault to the cook who posted this, was the saltines of the dish itself. I have been using sea salts for so long that the salt used in most things is overpowering, so next time I will use a low sodium salt and I think that will do it. Thank you for posting this recipe.
Easy to make and very tasty.

Huge hit at Xmas eve dinner! I added an extra can of artichoke hearts and a 1/2 cup of sour cream, simply because I had them and wanted to make a little more dip. So yummy! Those were my only changes.
I did this recipe for Christmas party and it was gone as soon as I set it out everyone complimented! I did used marinated artichokes so it may have added extra flavor, that was good!
Instead of mayonnaise, I used sour cream. I also added salt and pepper to taste and about 1 1/2 Tbs of heavy whipping cream for a rich flavor. It came out great!
I followed the recipe but noticed no seasoning. I put in a Tbs of Tuscan Rosemary dry rub, tsp minced garlic and tsp extra hit horseradish.
Um delish! And an easy recipe for the kids to help make too. I used a bunch of fresh spinach (cooked first) and added a few cloves of garlic.
Made this tonight for my daughter's birthday party & everyone loved it! Very quick & easy to prepare. This recipe is a keeper!
really good, but next time i will try it with a little less artichoke
I've made this several times and it is always a big hit.

Great recipe! My first attempt at making my favorite appetizer. I prepared it tonight for a function tomorrow. Tasted it after prep...wonderful! I did divert from the recipe a bit by simply adding two cloves of crushed garlic and some black pepper to taste. Cannot wait to serve it to my friends tomorrow!

I made this the other night and everyone loved it. The only thing I did differently was to put about double the artichokes in it, thanks to a very large jar from Costco. I served it with crackers, tortilla chips, and a boule of crusty bread--something for everbody. This was so easy and it really didn't need the sour cream or cream cheese I've seen in other recipes. I will definitely be making this again!
I love this! I used 1/2 cup non fat plain yoghurt and only 1/4 cup of mayo. It took some of the fat out, but still tasted wonderful. MMM

This dip is SO delicious. I made it when I had family in over the holidays (6 people were enjoying it) and it was a huge hit! I doubled it, which made a lot! Doubling is not needed unless you have a lot of very hungry people.

Delicious and easy to make with just 5 ingredients. I used freshly grated Parmesan and Monterey Jack cheeses; served warm with Stacy's naked pita chips and Triscuits. Will be making this again soon and my son wants to make it for a New Years Eve party he's attending in a couple of days. If you want a warm and hearty dip that guests will enjoy, I recommend this recipe.

Very good, easy and quick although I did make a couple of alterations. I used a bag of fresh baby spinach, sautÃ©ed in butter and garlic. Mixed with the remaining ingredients and then added a few shakes of hot pepper sauce. Served it in a small crockpot instead of baking in oven. Really good with garlic parmesan Italian toasts.
I made this in a crock pot and the consistency was way too thick and burnt. And the taste was bad, not just bland but tasted bad. I won't make this again.

I agree this is an amazing dip. I followed some of the tips in the comments, such as: 1/2 cup mayo & 1/2 cup sour cream instead of 1 full cup mayo. Added salt, pepper, powdered garlic & minced garlic. One of the times I made it, I used fresh spinach which I sauteed prior to mixing with the other ingredients. Both versions were VERY well received!! Thank you!

This was great. I couldn't find Monterey Jack, so I used a 4-cheese Italian blend instead. I've recently become a believer in Hellman's mayonnaise... it seems to taste less mayo-y than other mayonnaises. I also added a fair amount of freshly ground black pepper.

My daughter and I made this as a Thanksgiving appetizer and it was a great hit. We used pepper jack cheese to add a little kick, and upped the amount of parmesan to 1 1/2 cups. Will be making this again, and often.
I make this dip frequently. The only thing I do differently is to add about 4 cloves of garlic. Of course, that is a personal preference because I LOVE garlic.

I used a tad more spinach and wished I hadn't. It came out a bit dry, but only due to user error. The flavor was pretty good. I also added two minced cloves of garlic, just because. But I could imagine it without it and it would've been great anyway. Next time I might try adding a shallot. But great recipe and everyone loved it!
Will definitely keep it in a crock pot next time to keep it creamy and hot.....it got cold sitting out and became not quite as appetizing, I think, because there was still a lot left. But kept hot,
it would've been totally gone. Thanks for the recipe!

Addictive and delicious. Used pepper jack shreds and cut it back to 1 cup; used marinated artichoke hearts; and added 3 cloves minced garlic. just before baking, sprinkled about 2 tablespoons of parmesean shreds on top. A big hit at my party!

I've been looking for the perfect spinach and artichoke dip for awhile, and had high hopes for this one, but felt like it needed some more flavor. I had the strangest desire to add some red pepper flakes to it.
This is incredible! I used 1/2 Miracle Whip and 1/2 sour cream instead of 1 cup mayo. I also used fresh spinach, chopped instead of the frozen. We love it!

This recipe was ok however sort of bland. So I decided to add a bit more. I added 5 oz cream cheese, 1 1/2 tsp garlic, 1 tsp of black pepper and 3/4 tsp Zatarans blackened seasoning. After doing so I dont think I can eat this dip at a restaurant due to this one being the BEST I have ever had!
My family loved it!! Super easy to make....My family would rather have mine than one from any restaurant.
The first few bites were good, then it got to be too much for me. It was thick and heavy. I think using canned vegetables really hurt this recipe for me.
Super yummy!
I love this dip. I make it for all my gatherings and everyone loves it, i do sprinkle a little extra parmesan cheese on top

Good as is, with a bit of a mayo-y taste and overkill with the spinach (and I love spinach). This time, I'm doubling the recipe, cutting a quarter cup of the mayo, and I added 2 tsp of garlic (2 cloves in a double recipe). Regardless, it's still tasty!!
Delicious!!! Didn't need all the cheese on the top though. So easy and so fast to make.

I wasn't overly wowed by this, like it's missing something, maybe some garlic. I did do the 1/2 mayo, 1/2 sour cream tip and used fiesta cheese instead of the monterrey jack. I also use fresh spinach as I can't stand messing with the frozen kind...so maybe it's my mistake adding the changes!
So easy and one of the best I have made! Added as a favorite for game day!

This was good but needed more flavour. I used 1/2 light sour cream and 1/2 light mayo as I thought all mayo would be too oily. I think next time I will add some fresh garlic, sea salt and fresh ground pepper. Bottom line is that this is a good base recipe.

I love this recipe! I've made it many times and it is so easy and well-received. At Christmas I accidentally used pepper-jack cheese instead of monterey jack and my family LOVED it! It gave it a nice kick and made it really stand out from other versions.
Made for a Super Bowl party, gone in about 20 minutes. I did not make any changes, followed the recipe exactly and EVERYONE loved it. Thanks.
I have been making this recipe for years and everyone loves it. I even get special requests for this.
